smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function dateViewText appears to be too complex.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'MainActivity' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: FunctionNaming
smells.description: Function names should follow the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should match the pattern: ^([a-z$][a-zA-Z$0-9]*)|(`.*`)$

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: org.joda.time.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.github.salomonbrys.kotson.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.mcxiaoke.koi.ext.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.app.Activity.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.app.DatePickerDialog.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData1) to now.minusYears(0).minusMonths(0).minusDays(1).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData2) to now.minusYears(0).minusMonths(0).minusDays(24).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData3) to now.minusYears(0).minusMonths(0).plusDays(24).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData4) to now.minusYears(0).minusMonths(3).minusDays(0).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData5) to now.minusYears(1).minusMonths(3).minusDays(0).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData6) to now.minusYears(0).minusMonths(3).minusDays(24).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData7) to now.minusYears(1).minusMonths(3).minusDays(10).minusHours(0).minusMinutes(0)`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `i18n(R.string.sampleData8) to now.minusYears(1).minusMonths(3).minusDays(10).minusHours(10).minusMinutes(52)`
